page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: ARCHITECTURAL SURVEY of Buckland Common. Here there are two main types of buildings:pre-WW1 and modern houses. Pre-WW1: One of these houses stood out very clearly with its early Victorian style.It dated from 1837,and had two storeys.Several additions,however,had been made in modern times,notably a garage.The windows had diamond-shaped panes of glass separated by thin strips of lead.The roof was made of old tiles,and bumpy.A section of roof also covered each upper window.The house was large,in a rough rectangle,but with added buildings round the edge.There was an extremely small garden with just a patch of grass and a few trees.The porch consisted of two crumbling columns of brick supporting a stone.Also of
